This video describes near to me a travel destination recommender for people who like to travel outside mainstream tourism, visiting places that match their personal interests.
Near to me was developed with input to media.
This is John.
John is our typical user.
He likes to travel, but when he travels he seeks authentic experiences that allow him to connect to the spirit of a place he doesn't like massive tourism activities and locations.
However, the living culture of a city is as complex and multi dimensional as a cultural expressions of the people who inhabited, and it can provide authentic experiences in many domains.
For example, food, extreme sports, architecture, technology.
Fashion, environmentalism etc.
For this reason, the random choice of activities outside the mainstream can result in.
These are choices that are too far from John's interests for him to engage.
Don't best enjoy situations that take place in the intersection of his own identity and out of the place.
When John visits places, he takes pictures not only of landmarks he intends to visit, but also of interesting and curious things he finds along the way to them.

The subject of these pictures appeal to him because of their descriptive value of the spirit of the place, a relationship to some activity or interest that he likes, their aesthetic value, or usually a combination of these.
He uploads these pictures to a photo sharing website where he tagged them in order to organize them.
Describe them.
And add context.
Each of the pictures he takes also has a geotag, but marks where the picture was taken.
In many different corners of the world, other travellers like John also engage in similar photography, taking tagging and sharing activities for their collective behavior.
They create a pool of geolocated pictures that describe the spirit of each place and also the spirit of each of themselves.
What's interesting about these pictures is that they were spontaneous.
I like checking in or map based travel routes that usually related to famous landmarks only.
These pictures portray less known places that travelers found interesting.
Any places it doesn't matter if they're famous or not even doesn't matter if the travelers who visited them don't know their names.
But let's go back to John.
John wants to visit Paris.

He turns on his laptop logs into near to me and Justice Paris as his destination near to me is an application that leverages the information within an around travelers pictures to allow users to explore places from a personalized perspective, even if their interests are outside the mainstream.
Near to me knows John's interests based on the locations where he took pictures during his previous travels.
For example, we can see from pictures of John at the Borough Market in London and other markets that John has visited that John enjoys going to local markets to discover local food and crafts.
Other travelers also share this interest.
Travelers who enjoy visiting markets are likely to do so in many of the cities that they visit.
Because of this geotags marking the places where markets are unlikely to Co occur within travelers pictures sets.
In this case, travelers at visited their Borough Market in London are much more likely than other people to have also visited the Marshall Wilson in Paris to near.
To me, this means that these two places unrelated we can assume that if don't enjoy the Borough Market, he will enjoy visiting the Marshall Wilson during his trip to Paris and recommend it to him.
Since this market is not a mainstream tourism destination, it is unlikely that John would have found it by traditional means.
Let's see how this is done.
The near to me interface shows John five panels in the first panel there are pictures of the places near to me recommends for him.
In the next one, a map showing the places, locations.
The third panel shows a list containing the names of these places, which are produced automatically by near to me, based on the pictures details.
Next, Attack Cloud describes a things that he can find in these places.
The tags are clustered into topics with only one representative tag showing for each topic.
To ensure that John can have a Broadview without clutter.
Unless a list of travelers who shared John's interests and have photographed these places.
John sees a picture he finds interesting when he hovers their cursor over it.
Only information related to this place highlights in each panel.
Clicking on the picture, John dives into this location.
The panel so that their content and John is now exploring the Trocadero area.
The tag cloud shows what near to me recommends for John Integrado.
Don't clicks on market.
He's now in Paris, Trocadero area market.
The tags now show, among other things, Marshall Wilson.
This is what he's seeing.
The pictures depict the place near to me makes sure that the pictures are diverse enough for him to have a good idea of what can be found or done in this place.
John likes the place and saves it to his travel plans, naming it.
Marsha Wilson.
John wonders if there are any other interesting markets in Paris.
He removes the Tokyo Area label and now he can see all the Paris markets.
Some travelers appear start.
This means that their expert market chroniclers and photographers.
By clicking on this user's Avatar, John can experience markets in Paris from her perspective.
He sees several markets he's interested in, and he adds the group to his travel plans.
He continues to explore Paris and save stuff to his travel plans.
John is now in Paris.
He logs into near to me from his mobile phone.
From his phone, he can continue exploring places and things as usual, but also access his save travel plans and use him as his personalized guide while in Paris.
He can set alert for near to me to notify him when he's close to his safe locations, or use the navigation function for near to me to guide him there.
He looks for the Marshall Wilson in his travel plans.
And he selects take me there.
The Navigation service opens to give him instructions.
On his way to the Marshall Wilson, John finds an interesting building and wants to know what it is.
He takes a picture of it with his phone and uses near to me image based search to learn more about it.
Finally, the market is around the corner.
Another opportunity for Discovery whose pictures on location along the way will fuel more recommendations, an exploration.
